result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brady James Peterka in court. Court as to status of counsel. Court questions defendant's ability to procced and requests Sheriff's Department have him tested for Controlled Substances. Defendant may be released after providing sample. Status Hearing set for July, 21, 2022 at 08:15am.
Bond funds received from Sheriff's Office.
Sheriff's Office advises bond was posted on 5/23/2022.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No contact with: any bars or taverns or liquor stores, any business whos primary purpose is to provide alcohol. Must obey all terms of the bail orders.

3:34 PM Defendant Brady James Peterka in court by video from the Ozaukee County Jail. Atty. Matthew Nugent appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant would not talk to the PD today. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant will retain counsel. Court finds probable cause. Court finds good cause for not scheduling a preliminary hearing. State recommends $1000 cash bail. Court orders $1000 cash bail w/conditions.
Status hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
